VNS_desc: Inaccuracy occurs when the data points, labels, or other elements do not precisely represent the underlying data.
Incompatibility arises when a data visualization is not ppropriately tailored to input variables.
Ambiguity occurs when a data visualization fails to clarify the mappings from data to visuals and, making users uncertain of how to decode data.
Unfairness presents different data points or categories following different standards or baselines.
Low readability means the data visualization is unreadable or illegible.
Low efficiency indicates that the data visualization requires excessive cognitive effort for users to comprehend the information it presents.
Over-complexity refers to the opposite of over-simplification, where a data visualization becomes overly intricate and convoluted.
Over-simplification occurs when a data visualization miss essential components.
Abnormality signifies instances where the design choices of the data visualization diverge significantly from standard conventions or practices.
Aggresion creates a negative user experience by employing overly aggressive visual elements.
